availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew B. Dean (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Married Mary A. Borie Dean in Louisville, Kentucky, on October 2, 1856. Father of William Dean, Cassandra Dean, Joseph Dean and Stonewall J. Dean. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 125.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 273A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Two Mile House, p. 454A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Spring Garden, p. 139B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819605.
"Death of Mr. A. B. DEAN," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), December 12, 1881, p. 2.
